title: Inside Ant McPartlin and Anne-Marie Corbett's plush new Wimbledon love nest
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Ant McPartlin has moved into his new house with his girlfriend Anne-Marie Corbett, and the plush pad is worth a whopping £6 million.

The pair spent a year working on renovations to transform it into their dream home and they have now finally been able to get in and unpack.

The mansion boasts a spacious driveway lined by tall trees, with lavish pillars outside framing the front door.

Situated in London's posh Wimbledon Village, it's the first home that the TV presenter and his new girlfriend are sharing together.

(Image: STEVE FINN PHOTOGRAPHY)

He bought the seven bedroom mansion a year ago, and lives there with Anne-Marie, her two daughters from a previous relationship and their pet dogs.

The new love pad has modern amenities including a huge open plan kitchen and dining room, several reception rooms and it's located close to a park - so it has everything they could possibly ask for.

But the move has ended the era of living next door to co-star Dec Donnelly, who has been his neighbour for the past two decades, but it will be a fresh start for the Britain's Got Talent presenter.

The presenting duo have lived close to each other for years, but Ant reportedly handed the keys to his ex wife Lisa Armstrong and has moved to south London to start again.

The country pile boasts its own cinema room, an orangery and an enormous open-plan kitchen and dining room, as well as a free-standing bath in the master bedroom's sprawling en suite bathroom - with his 'n' hers sinks.

The love nest also boasts a home cinema and a seriously swanky master bathroom.

An insider told The Sun of the couple's new pad: "The property is perfect for them.

"It has everything they want and marks an important milestone in their relationship together."

description: The presenter has moved into his new home with girlfriend Anne-Marie and her daughters after spending a year having it renovated
